text: Cornufer is a genus of frogs in the family Ceratobatrachidae. Brown et al. (2015), a group of scientists, made it bigger: They placed most Australasian frogs in the family Ceratobatrachidae. These frogs live in Melanesia and Polynesia -- in Palau, Fiji, New Guinea, and in the Admiralty, Bismarck, and Solomon Islands. ==Species== There are more than 50 species of frogs in this genus. *
